Class TeacherLoginController

java.lang.Object
comp3111.examsystem.controller.TeacherLoginController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class TeacherLoginController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller class for handling teacher login and registration functionalities in the examination system. This class manages user interactions for logging in and registering teachers, including validation of input data and communication with the teacher database.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the controller and the teacher database. This method is automatically called after the FXML file has been loaded.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • login

      public void login(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Handles the login action for the teacher. Validates the username and password, and if successful, opens the main UI.
      Parameters:
      e - The ActionEvent triggered by the login button.

    • register

      public void register(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Opens the teacher registration UI when the register button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      e - The ActionEvent triggered by the register button.

    • close

      public void close(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Closes the current window when the close button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      e - The ActionEvent triggered by the close button.

    • enterinfo

      public void enterinfo(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Handles the information submission during the registration process. Validates the input data and registers a new teacher if valid.
      Parameters:
      e - The ActionEvent triggered by the submit button.
